        public readonly bool Equals(DapperDateTimeVo other)
        {
            // It's possible to create uninitialized instances via converters such as EfCore (HasDefaultValue), which call Equals.

            if(!_isInitialized || !other._isInitialized) return false;

            return System.Collections.Generic.EqualityComparer<System.DateTime>.Default.Equals(Value, other.Value);

        public readonly bool Equals(System.DateTime primitive) => Value.Equals(primitive);

        {
            return obj is DapperDateTimeVo && Equals((DapperDateTimeVo) obj);

        public static bool operator !=(DapperDateTimeVo left, DapperDateTimeVo right) => !(left == right);

        public static bool operator !=(DapperDateTimeVo left, System.DateTime right) => !Equals(left.Value, right);

        public static bool operator !=(System.DateTime left, DapperDateTimeVo right) => !Equals(left, right.Value);

        public class DapperTypeHandler : Dapper.SqlMapper.TypeHandler<DapperDateTimeVo>
        {
            public override void SetValue(System.Data.IDbDataParameter parameter, DapperDateTimeVo value)
            {
                parameter.DbType = System.Data.DbType.DateTime;
                parameter.Value = value.Value;

            public override DapperDateTimeVo Parse(object value)
            {
                return value switch

                    string stringValue when
